channel.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
channel.description:
Here's the list so far. Tweaks are still being made, and rebates are not included on the individual listings. But the total accounts for them. Also, the Megolith heatsink I intend to get is not listed either since Newegg is presently out of stock. The heatsink will have a push and pull fan system as well.
Simply looking for opinions on different products. Also, budget is flexible.
1x LG DVD Burner - Bulk Black SATA Model GH24NS50 - OEM Item #: N82E16827136177 Return Policy: Standard Return Policy $24.99
1x SILVERSTONE TJ10-B Black Aluminum ATX Full Tower Computer Case Item #: N82E16811163091 Return Policy: Standard Return Policy $299.99
2x Western Digital RE3 WD1002FBYS 1TB 7200 RPM SATA 3.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Hard Drive -Bare Drive Item #: N82E16822136313 Return Policy: Standard Return Policy $279.98 ($139.99 each)
3x ASUS VW266H Black 25.5" 2ms(GTG) HDMI Widescreen LCD Monitor Item #: N82E16824236047 Return Policy: Monitor Standard Return Policy $989.97 ($299.99 each)
2x EVGA 015-P3-1482-AR GeForce GTX 480 (Fermi) SuperClocked 1536MB 384-bit GDDR5 PCI Express 2.0 x16 HDCP Ready SLI Support ... Item #: N82E16814130551 Return Policy: VGA Replacement Only Return Policy $1,059.98 ($509.99 each)
1x CORSAIR HX Series CMPSU-1000HX 1000W ATX12V 2.2 / EPS12V 2.91 SLI Ready CrossFire Ready 80 PLUS Certified Modular Active ... Item #: N82E16817139007 Return Policy: Standard Return Policy $279.99
1x Arctic Silver 5 Thermal Compound - OEM Item #: N82E16835100007 Return Policy: Consumable Item Refund Only Return Policy $9.99
1x CORSAIR DOMINATOR-GT 6GB (3 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1866 Desktop Memory Model CMT6GX3M3A1866C9 Item #: N82E16820145292 Return Policy: Memory Standard Return Policy $319.99
1x EVGA E760 CLASSIFIED "Overclocker's Pick" 3-Way SLI + PhysX 1366 Intel X58 EATX Intel Motherboard Item #: N82E16813188048 Return Policy: Limited Replacement Only Return Policy $419.99
1x Intel Core i7-860 Lynnfield 2.8GHz LGA 1156 95W Quad-Core Processor BX80605I7860 Item #: N82E16819115214 Return Policy: CPU Replacement Only Return Policy $289.99
5x Scythe S-FLEX SFF21E 120mm Case Fan Item #: N82E16835185005 Return Policy: Standard Return Policy $99.95 ($13.49 each)
Subtotal: $3,862.31[/SIZE]

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
Today is D day. Everything is in local and will be here hopefully within the next 2 hours.

Final order:

Case: Cooler Master ATCS 840 Black
CPU: Intel i7 930 @ 2.8GHz
Mobo: ASUS Rampage III Extreme
Memory: 12GB Corsair Dominator GT 1600
GPU: SLI ASUS ENGTX480
PSU: Silverstone 1000w
Fans: 3x Scythe 120mm
CPU Cooler: Corsair H50
SSD : OCZ 120GB Vertex 2
CD Drive: ASUS Sata 24x DVD Burner
Monitor: ASUS 25.5" (2ms) 1920x1200

Can’t wait.

Read full topic

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Zeus
item.description:
Man, all this talk about cases is making me depressed.
I have a Cooler Master Elite 310. (Blue)
It’s nice, but it was really cheap.
Although it does have a steel body, that’s a plus.

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Versions of what? I’m still not sure what is forcing you to look for such a tiny drive which is actually so old it’s hard to find. How much are you paying?

EDIT: Well, that’s different. Though I’d suggest you save your money and be more patient while booting. Also, FYI the new drive I bought is a Caviar Green, which are the slower WD drives. Then again, I don’t intend to be booting from it or playing Crysis off it, but rather use it as a mass storage device for movies and shows, which it’s plenty fast enough for, leaving my old 320G drive as the boot/work drive. Though it seems the old one still isn’t much faster than the new one, if at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
If I’m lost in translation, I apologize but… Fnoigy, he’s talking about a Solid State Drive, not Hard Disk Drive. SSDs are good for OS/Application boot times. 5$ wouldn’t even get you a 4GB flashdrive.

Read full topic

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig

item.description:
Fnoigy, im in england, we do have some different versions.

@Victus - Hopefully tommorow if not anywhere till the 12th (maximum)

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

Im considering getting a 60gb and you got this.

Bastard.

What the hell? I can’t even find 60GB drives on Newegg, the smallest they have is 72 (which I guess would end up being 60 after formatting), and those are apparently high-performance ones and cost a lot. Seriously, what the hell is limiting you to searching for a 60GB drive? Unless you’re buying a garbage old used one for $5 or something, then you may as well go higher for the price increase. If you really can’t afford anything other than some ancient used thing, then maybe you should reconsider your financial priorities.

Read full topic

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

Im considering getting a 60gb and you got this.

Bastard.

I don’t need all that size. I have a 500 external for videos/music/school. SSD is for gaming and applications. Hell, my 110GB HDD isn’t even full of games/apps.

How long until Windows 7 gets in man?

Read full topic

id be talking to you on steam but, im on ubuntu and havent bothered to sort it yet.

item.title: Moddifying My Dream Rig
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
So! I mah have solved my issue with the case. Lian Li. Anyone think I can get away with this using everything else?

Note: The mobo would change from the Rampage III Extreme to the Rampage III Gene, I would downgrade to a modular Thermaltake 850w modular PSU. Everything else remains the same.

Think airflow would be sufficient? Or should I upgrade the free 120mm in the front? [The other would house the H50]

Just realized this is a double post…

Read full topic
